messages.message:
Hey, do we have plans to apply OCR confidence as a doc level validation? (instead of field level). I think this ticket is the most relevant - https://instabase.atlassian.net/browse/EPD-2809

I tend to find that when OCR confidence is poor in situations when we are always expecting typed (not handwritten) docs, often the whole document has low OCR conf (e.g. blurred photo). Instead of applying OCR conf to each field individually in these cases, it feels much more intuitive to me to apply the validation at the doc level (e.g. average OCR confidence for whole doc is < 90% threshold). I imagine this acting like a bit like classification confidence (but could also be an upstream process I suppose)
So we don't have a ticket as far as I know regarding document level OCR, but thats an interesting need. @Hamish do you mind creating a ticket?
@Serena we do already capture this information right in the OCR heatmap
yep we have OCR confidence values in the backend since we already use them for OCR confidence validation rules for fields
Specifically for the entire document I mean (unless you are saying we use that average number also in validations)

ah yes, we already have the OCR confidence for the entire document - we pull from this when running OCR confidence validation rules for fields by getting the OCR confidence for each word in the field value
